newsitem.title: USA: U.S. Spring/White Wheat - Spring wheat bids down.
newsitem.headline: U.S. Spring/White Wheat - Spring wheat bids down.

text.p: Elevator bids for spring wheat were lower in the northern wheat belt, pressured by a five-cent drop in July MGE spring wheat futures, grain dealers said.
Most dealers said sales were light as farmers concentrated on fieldwork where the weather allowed.
North Dakota's Red River Valley since Thursday has received several inches of rain that muddied fields and halted fieldwork.
"It was probably good for the grain that was in," said one North Dakota dealer. The Red River Valley needed rain to soften crusted topsoil and aid crop development.
Rain also fell in north central Montana, which dealers there said was badly needed.
CCC bought 13,500 tonnes of soft white wheat for donation to Pakistan on Friday from Columbia Grain Intl at $174.93 a tonne FOB Portland. Shipment is for June 10-July 5.
Price per bushel for 14-pct protein dark northern spring, durum and white wheats, in dollars per bushel:
Spring Chg Durum(m) Chg White Chg
Spring Chg HRW 13pct Chg White Chg
